Overview 
 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Event and Intent Mechanism

There are many situations where the Jibe SDK Service needs to notify a client application of some change in state. The Jibe SDK uses two mechanisms to implement these notifications:

  • Android Intents are used to notify an application (which may not currently be running) that an unsolicited event has occurred, i.e. an event that the application did not previously request. This includes such situations as the arrival of chat messages, or inbound requests to take part in a file-transfer (or video-sharing) session.
  • Events are used to inform an application of the status of an operation that the application previously requested

Android Intents

The Jibe SDK uses the Android Intent mechanism, to notify a (potentially inactive) application that events have occurred. The SDK uses the Broadcast Intent mechanism, so applications need to declare a interest in the Intents that they wish to receive.

The Intents generated by the Jibe SDK are defined in the JibeIntents class.

Event Mechanism

The JibeEventService implements an observer mechanism, which allows client applications to register an interest in specific categories of events. The service will then call the application, whenever such an event occurs.

Event categories exist for all of the main service features. These are defined in JibeEvent.Category

Event notification is asynchronous, and therefore non-blocking: the client application's processing of an event will not cause the Jibe SDK Service to wait.
